discussion.p: LWG issue added "It is implementation-defined whether over-aligned types are supported (C++14 ??3.11)." to the specification of std::experimental::optional in LFTS, however that issue wasn't moved until optional had already been merged to the IS working paper, so it isn't present in the specification of std::optional. Should the same rule be added for std::optional as well?

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4687.

blockquote.p: […] The contained value shall be allocated in a region of the optional<T> storage suitably aligned for the type T. It is implementation-defined whether over-aligned types are supported (). When an object of type optional<T> is contextually converted to bool, the conversion returns true if the object contains a value; otherwise the conversion returns false.
